_prev_prog_2.Description:
Rumford Power complies with the regulatory requirements set forth under EPA's Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions (40 CFR  68), Risk Management Program as it applies to aqueous ammonia.



The major safety features of the aqueous ammonia Selective Catalytic Reduction system are summarized below.



- Containment berm constructed around aqueous ammonia storage tank is capable of holding entire contents of SCR Aqueous Ammonia system in the event of a catastrophic failure of the storage tank.

- Containment berm is equipped with ammonia sensors which alarm to the control room in the event of an ammonia release in the berm.

- Aqueous ammonia tank is equipped with a level monitoring system and high level alarm to alert personnel in the event of an abnormal operating level.

- Rumford Power personnel are on site 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Rounds are made on a scheduled basis to monitor all systems performance and to take appropriate action in the event of an emergency.

- Ammonia pump and SCR skids are equipped with containment dikes to isolate liquid in the event of an ammonia leak.

_prev_prog_3.Description:
Through their active Process Safety Management Program, Rumford Power is in compliance with the regulatory requirements of OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.119, Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals.



The following engineering and administrative controls are in place to eliminate or reduce the possibility of an accidental release at the Rumford Power facility:



* Electronic ammonia detection, (4 detectors) installed in chiller building and safety relief valve stack. Detection system activates visual alarms at the facility main control center to alert personnel of a possible ammonia leak in the chiller system.

* Ammonia detection is hard wired to ventilation system to activate exhaust fans in the event of a release in the chiller building.

* Chiller System Controls monitor and control compressors, condenser, vessels and ammonia pumps. System displays continual operational status of equipment and controls alarms / shutdowns for out of  parameter indications. 

* High level alarms and system shut offs are installed on pressure vessels. Abnormal operating levels sensed in the vessels will activate a shutdown of the compressors.

* Safety relief valves are configured to all pressure vessels to eliminate the potential for an over-pressure condition within the vessel and the refrigeration system.

* Emergency stop button installed outside chiller building and in facility main control room to stop all ammonia refrigeration equipment and start exhaust fans in the event of a release.

* Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) is instituted within the maintenance department to ensure all chiller system components are maintained in optimum operational and mechanical condition in accordance with industry and manufacturers recommendations.

* Continual vibration analysis of compressors and condenser fans is provided to alert maintenance personnel of potential equipment malfunction, or failure.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



- Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Rumford Power is strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This commitment is inherent to our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with our regulated process. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible accidental releases of regulated substances. It is our goal to achieve and sustain "Zero Accident Tolerance" through communication, information, and training. However, if such an accidental release does occur, we are coordinated with the Rumford Fire Department and the Oxford County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) for emergency response support.



- The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled



Rumford Power is a combined cycle power plant. The regulated substances handled on location are Anhydrous Ammonia, which is used in the Chiller System as a coolant to enhance gas turbine performance. The second regulated substance is Aqueous Ammonia, which is used in the Selective Catalytic Reduction (SCR) system to reduce NOx emissions from the power plant.  The Chiller System regulated substance is covered under Program 3 of the RMP regulations.  The SCR systems regulated substance is covered under Program 2 of the RMP regulations.

 

- Offsite Consequence Analysis

 

The Worst Case Release Scenario(s) and the Alternative Release Scenario(s), including administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for each reported scenario have been completed.  To evaluate the worst case and alternative release scenarios, EPA's RMP Comp software was utilized exclusively. The worst case and alternate case release scenarios have been calculated and the results of the calculations are documented in the Rumford Power RMP Plan.  Public and environmental receptors that could pos

sibly be affected by the release scenarios were determined through the use CAPS, Circular Area Profiling System software and US Census Bureau 2020 data. 



- The General Accidental Release Prevention Program



The general accident release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps at Rumford Power are to comply with EPA's Accidental Prevention Rule, OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. Each process and the process equipment at Rumford Power was designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with the  previously mentioned codes, laws, and regulations.



- Accident History



Rumford Power has had no accidents associated with ammonia use.



 - Emergency Response Program



Rumford Power is equipped with an ammonia detection and emergency alarm system for the Chiller System.  In the event of an alarm there are specific procedures that all employees must follow. These written procedures can be found in the Rumford Power Emergency Plan.  The procedures include evacuation of personnel and notification of authorities. The Oxford County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the Rumford Fire Department are trained and equipped to respond to ammonia releases at Rumford Power



- Planned Changes to Improve Safety:



Rumford Power currently has no changes planned for the Chiller System and SCR System at this time. However, the process will be subjected to periodic process hazard analysis reviews for the purpose of identifying potential hazards and implementing the necessary improvement to provide a safer system. Rumford Power personnel will also periodically review all potential opportunities to improve the safety of our personnel, the surrounding community, and the ammonia refrigeration process through required compliance audits and management of change procedures.
